evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: This Court is authorized to enter a declaratory judgment under 28 U.S.C. §2201.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Issue a permanent injunction prohibiting the Defendants, their agents, employees, representatives, contractors or any third party acting on their behalf from any enforcement or application of the exclusion of surgeries for “sex gender change” in 10 U.S.C. § 1079(a)(11), including surgeries for gender dysphoria, through regulations, policies or any other means, and directing Defendants to provide TRICARE coverage for Plaintiff Jane Doe’s medically necessary gender affirming surgical procedures;

evidence.source_document: Plaintiffs Jane Doe and Susan Roe's Response and Objection to Notice Filed by the U.S. House of Representatives
Plaintiffs Jane Doe and Susan Roe's Response and Objection to Notice Filed by the U.S. House of Representatives
evidence.text: granted [the parties’] motion for entry of a consent judgment [after a settlement agreement had been reached].

evidence.source_document: Order on Cross-Motions for Summary Judgment
evidence.text: issue a permanent injunction prohibiting the Defendants, their agents, employees, representatives, contractors or any third party acting on their behalf from any enforcement or application of the exclusion of surgeries for “sex gender change” in 10 U.S.C. § 1079(a)(11), including surgeries for gender dysphoria, through regulations, policies or any other means, and directing Defendants to provide TRICARE coverage for Plaintiff Jane Doe’s medically necessary gender affirming surgical procedures;

extracted.value: issue a permanent injunction prohibiting the Defendants, their agents, employees, representatives, contractors or any third party acting on their behalf from any enforcement or application of the exclusion of surgeries for “sex gender change” in 10 U.S.C. § 1079(a)(11), including surgeries for gender dysphoria, through regulations, policies or any other means, and directing Defendants to provide TRICARE coverage for Plaintiff Jane Doe’s medically necessary gender affirming surgical procedures;

evidence.source_document: Order on Cross-Motions for Summary Judgment
evidence.text: Declaratory judgment will therefore be entered stating that the Statutory Exclusion is unconstitutional as applied to the Plaintiffs.

extracted.value: Declaratory judgment will therefore be entered stating that the Statutory Exclusion is unconstitutional as applied to the Plaintiffs.

evidence.source_document: Order on Cross-Motions for Summary Judgment
evidence.text: The parties are directed to meet and confer and to inform the Court by November 15, 2024 whether injunctive relief is necessary, and if it is, to propose an injunction consistent with this order.

extracted.value: The parties are directed to meet and confer and to inform the Court by November 15, 2024 whether injunctive relief is necessary, and if it is, to propose an injunction consistent with this order.
